result.execSummary:
The defendant QUANTEZ D ARNOLD was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -Court grants the defendant 84 days of sentence credit if revoked.

miscConds.notes: -Joint & Several. Restitution is to be paid to the probation office and is to be paid within 120 days of the sentence date or defendant will need to serve the jail sentence imposed on count 3.

-To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

-No Contact with the victim - Page Trucking. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. 
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment and follow-up as recommended. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

ADDRESS INFO for QUANTEZ D ARNOLD
Current: 618 Concepts 21 Dr, Lithonia, GA 30058 United States  (Effective: 07-13-2022)
Prior: 571 Cty Rd A, C/O Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941 United States
June 20, 2022 Plea and Sentencing
for Transcript

3:14 PM Defendant QUANTEZ D ARNOLD in court, in custody.  Attorney Margaret Marlene Vinz in court for QUANTEZ D ARNOLD.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Vinz has received a copy of the amended information. Atty Vinz recites agreement - defendant will plea to counts 2, 3 & 8 with probation & conditions and count 1 will be dismissed and read-in. ADA concurs. Defendant concurs, 

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 2,3 & 8 and orders count 1 be dismissed and read-in. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights. Sentencing statement by ADA. Sentencing statement by Atty Vinz. Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

Count 2 / Count 3 / Count 8 - EACH:

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs. To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency. 
-Restitution of $716.03 joint & several.
-No Contact with the victim - Page Trucking. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. 
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment and follow-up as recommended. 
-Ct 3 - 4 months county jail, stayed for 120 days for payment of the restitution. Court will allow huber privileges.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Court grants the defendant 84 days of sentence credit if revoked.
Court orders any personal items in the jail belonging to the defendant can be returned. Court allows the cell phone to be returned to the defendant when it is returned to Green Lake County. Atty Vinz to do an order.

Court adjourned at 3:34 PM
Summary of Restitution and Costs - $716.03 joint & several

Letter from Atty Vinz to the Court, dated June 17, 2022, re: will withdraw motion to suppress and request plea and sentencing on June 20, 2022 hearing

NOTE: No objection by DA's office.
Order to Strike Defense Motion to Suppress

Motion to Strike

1:27 PM Defendant QUANTEZ D ARNOLD in court, in custody.  Attorney Margaret Marlene Vinz in court for QUANTEZ D ARNOLD.  Attorney Gerise Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Vinz acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Vinz enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Atty Vinz orally makes a speedy trial demand and makes statement regarding Discovery today. Statement by DA Laspisa. 

Court adjourned at 1:29 PM

Court will set for Motion Hearing (Motion to Suppress) on June 20, 2022 at 3:00 PM (1 hour)

Arraignment on May 24, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

10:29 AM Defendant QUANTEZ D ARNOLD in court, in custody.  Attorney Margaret Vinz in court for QUANTEZ D ARNOLD.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Vinz states the defendant request the prelim to proceed. State has one witness.

Jessica Schroeder sworn, direct by ADA McElroy is employed as a police officer for the City of Green Lake. Testimony given. Objection by Atty Vinz. Overruled. ADA McElroy continues with direct examination. Was employed on the date in question. Identified the defendant present in court. Cross exam by Atty Vinz. Redirect by ADA McElroy. Re-cross by Atty Vinz. Argument by ADA McElroy. Argument by Atty Vinz. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony has been committed and that the felony probably was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Court will set for Arraignment on May 24, 2022 at 1:15 PM. 

Court adjourned at 10:54 AM
(Atty Michael Kapelis)
Preliminary hearing on April 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

9:08 AM Defendant QUANTEZ D ARNOLD in court, in custody.  Attorney Margaret Vinz appeared in court for QUANTEZ ARNOLD. Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Vinz confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and requests a preliminary hearing within the time limits. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court notes bond has been set. Atty Vinz makes statement regarding amending the bond. Court denies bond modification request. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant does not waive the time limits. 

Court adjourned at 9:13 AM.

Court will set for Preliminary Hearing on April 19, 2022 at 10:30 AM.
